The women of Galilee had remained with the disciple John to see what disposition would be made of the body of Jesus, which was very precious to them, although their faith in Him as the promised Messiah had perished with Him. . . . The women were astonished to see Joseph and Nicodemus, both honored and wealthy councilors, as
68
anxious and interested as themselves for the proper disposal of the body of Jesus.--3SP 174, 175 (1878).
